net.afiake.samsungtvcontrol

Class SamsungTVControl

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.afiake.samsungtvcontrol.SamsungTVControl

  • public class SamsungTVControl
extends java.lang.Object
    API for controlling Samsung TVs using a socket connection on port 55000.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SamsungTVControl(java.lang.String controllerId, java.lang.String controllerName, java.lang.String host)
      Opens a socket connection to given host (a Samsung Smart TV).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void keyCode(KeyCode keyCode)
      Sends a keycode over current socket connection.

      Sends a keycode over current socket connection.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • SamsungTVControl

        public SamsungTVControl(java.lang.String controllerId,
                        java.lang.String controllerName,
                        java.lang.String host)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        AuthenticationException
        Opens a socket connection to given host (a Samsung Smart TV).
        Parameters:
        controllerId - a unique ID which is used at the Samsung TV internally to distinguish controllers
        controllerName - the name for this controller, which is displayed on the television
        host - the ip-address to connect to
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - there was a problem with the socket connection
        AuthenticationException - the television user denied our control request

    • Method Detail

      • keyCode

        public void keyCode(KeyCode keyCode)
             throws java.io.IOException
        Sends a keycode over current socket connection. Only works when you are successfully authenticated.
        Parameters:
        keyCode - the keycode to send
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - there was a problem with the socket connection

      • keyCode

        public void keyCode(java.lang.String keyCode)
             throws java.io.IOException
        Sends a keycode over current socket connection. Only works when you are successfully authenticated.
        Parameters:
        keyCode - the keycode to send
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - there was a problem with the socket connection
